programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: With little hands-on time and no special equipment, braising produces hearty, flavorful dishes. Martha shares recipes for pot roast, braised cabbage, and pulled pork shoulder.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha demonstrates healthful and versatile poached chicken breasts. She also shares recipes and techniques for poaching salmon and poaching eggs.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon’s guide to the ultimate home cooking continues as he shows us how to make deliciously healthy food.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay shows us how to make his favourite street food dishes at home. Recipes include delicious prawn tostada and irresistible caramel salted popcorn.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Home Cooking
programme.desc: Gordon shows us his favourite recipes for an Italian breakfast, lunch and dinner. Dishes include a fennel sausage frittata, griddled sardines with gremolata.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: After a shocking elimination, both teams must regroup and chart a new course.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs use cookbooks from Gordon's library to spell out the ingredients for their next challenge.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs have forty minutes to create their own interpretations of six southern dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Hell's Kitchen is hosting the International Ballroom Invitational and the contestants prepare a special menu.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In Arvada, Colorado, Chef Ramsay visits Old Neighborhood, a family-run eatery in need of major changes.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The owners of Kati Allo struggle to keep their eatery and their marriage together.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: An Italian restaurant is beset with problems, including an incompetent head chef and low morale among staff.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the luxury Lakeview Hotel in Lake Chelan, Washington. Owner Brent is at a loss, as he watches his dreams of being a success fail miserably.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Loudonville, Ohio, to try to rescue the Landoll's Mohican Castle. Despite spending millions of dollars to construct the European style castle, the business has started to fall apart and a family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs compete to cook for an Olympian and an NFL star.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The challenge in this episode sees the teams tackling a reception for newlyweds before a difficult service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams are tasked with creating Mexican dishes.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The teams are challenged to put a twist on some classic Italian dishes.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon shows us how to make the ultimate slow cooked dishes. Recipes include caramelised figs with ricotta, phenomenal slow-cooked beef short ribs and melting beef brisket.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: Gordon teaches us to cook some of his ultimate brunches. Recipes include his irresistible spicy pancakes, a simple and delicious frittata and a fool-proof cheat's souffle with 3 cheeses.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.sub-title: Home is Where the Heart Is - Part 2
programme.desc: Paula continues her trip down memory lane with old friends and shows us the family's "Riverbend" in her hometown of Albany, Georgia.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula pays homage to Chef Julia Child and prepares a classic Coq au vin.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Jamie Deen finally gets his pork chop as Paula prepares his favorite meal!

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha demonstrates braising, the technique behind three iconic dishes: Italian specialty osso buco, traditional Irish corned beef, and lamb shanks with aromatic spices.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha transforms rice from plain to extraordinary: crowd-pleasing paella, stuffed peppers, and Persian rice (rice cooked on top of thinly sliced, buttery potatoes).

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha shows how to make four vegetable dishes: steamed artichokes with tarragon butter, braised leeks, fried okra, and whole roasted garlic.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril offers some delicious meatless entrees: udon noodle stir fry with crunchy vegetables, hearty kale and chickpea stew, and eggplant and squash lasagna.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Emeril takes you on a trip to Spain as he shares his favorite meals: salt crusted branzino seasoned with citrus, grilled calamari, and seafood paella.

programme.title: Emeril's Table
programme.desc: Any time of year is a great time for a cookout! Join Emeril for grilled rack of lamb with mixed herb pesto and a side of grilled potatoes with feta.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie makes the perfect Hearty Beef Lasagna and Lan makes Chicken Scarpariello.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Julia and Bridget make a Texas classic, Flank Steak in Adobo. Ashley makes the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie makes an Oregon Blackberry Pie. Bridget and Julia make Roasted Salmon with Broccoli and Potatoes.

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Claudia Deen prepares a delicious and nutritious vegan lunch for Paula without Paula knowing... Wonder how this goes over?

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula goes non-traditional this Thanksgiving with a gorgeous beef tenderloin!

programme.title: Positively Paula
programme.desc: Paula shows us how to make three dishes that are staples for any Southern table.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Fried foods should be golden brown and never greasy. Martha deep-fries and pan-fries to perfection: French fries, panfried chicken, and Japanese tempura vegetables.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: A beautifully cooked roast makes a grand centerpiece for any dinner. Martha shares techniques for prime rib roast, crown roast of pork, and stuffed turkey breast.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Hearty stews are made with inexpensive cuts of meat and require little hands-on prep time. Martha demonstrates three classic recipes: beef stew, coq au vin, and veal stew.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Nothing comforts like a bowl of homemade soup. Once you master a few basics, you can make many variations. Watch Martha make chicken soup, minestrone, and spinach cream soup.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha blanches, steams, and roasts vegetables to enhance flavor and retain nutritional properties: crudités, steamed artichokes, vegetable tian, and roasted pepper salad.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Learn the art of making fresh pasta from scratch with Martha and Michael White, chef and pasta specialist: make pasta dough and form it into strands or shapes.
